intro: Tripleurospermum griersonii, commonly known as the Grierson's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy white seed heads, typical of the genus. It is often found in grassy areas and rocky soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both horticulture and ecological research.
